text: Delicious Ham!  And amazing service.  thank you.  We enjoyed it all and will be back.  Lots of good food for a low price too.

My boyfriend and I were starving and this place hit the spot. It's a quaint restaurant right next to the airport full of locals. The corned beef hash is the best I've ever had and adding cheese and onions to the hash browns was the right move. Food is insanely affordable but note, this establishment is cash only! If you don't stop in, you're missing out!
From out if town and just had the best breakfast 2nd only to a grandmother cooking. Friendly staff excellent service and great value with ample size servings. Safest place in Chicago to eat!
First time here. Had a Denver omelette with hash browns. Food is delicious and the staff is awesome. This will be my go to place for breakfast.
Great food. Awesome pricing! Staff was amazing and super friendly! The pork chops were delicious!
Great food. Hugh portions and reasonably price. Awesome customer service.

I loved this place. So small and unremarkable you'll likely drive right by it, I felt that time slowed down when I was here. The menu was small and simple; eggs, bacon, hash browns and coffee. Yes please. The service was so great and kind; you could tell the regulars when they walked in. I couldn't recommend this place more.
Quick friendly service and good food. Yelp review was very high. A reminder they only take cash.
Good place for breakfast and the staff is friendly. I will go there again.  I had the veggie omelet and coffee, no complaints.

4 dueces were great! Pancakes are huge and flat but so fluffy. The sausage link is fantastic too, one of a few that it does not smell strong. The price is really reasonably even cheaper than its quality. It is CASH ONLY be aware of that.
Good food. Great prices. Fantastic service. Quintessential Chicago place. I love it here.

I'm always looking for off the beaten path places when I'm out of town and this one seemed like a good one and was I right, friggen nailed it today. This place is one of those hidden gems because it was filled with locals and everyone new everyone by name, I was the out sider today. It's right across the street from Midway airport at the end of a departing runway because planes were taking off right over my head every couple minutes. The place is small with limited counter seating and some tables which were almost completely full by the 8am hour when I left. The place is definitely a dive as you can tell by my pictures. The decor is almost nonexistent and it just looks thrown together but don't let that fool you. Service was spectacular with every employee working the front taking care of me the whole time that I was there. The menu was I can't remember because when saw ham on the bone which I'm a sucker for because I hate the processed roll crap that most everyone serves now, you had me at ham on the bone so I looked no further. As I sat there I saw big plates of breakfast passing by. OMG when the plate hit the table I was like WTF three eggs, mound of hash browns, thick ass piece of ham steak and thick Greek toast, holy cow all that for $6.50, is this for real ?. The hash browns were perfect with a soft pillow like inside with a nice crispy golden brown skin all mixed up. The ham was probably the thickest slice I have ever been served with a very juicy/tender texture and nice flavor, no heavy smoke. The eggs were perfect sunny side up and the toast was perfect Greek with that little chew to it from the crust. Overall for $7 flat out the door before tip this was probably the best bang for the buck breakfast that I have ever had and it was better than average quality which was top notch. This place definitely knocked it out of the park and worth all the five stars. They go way out of way for the breakfast ham and eggs and the best that I have ever had hands down, breakfast is my favorite meal so I eat and review it more than any other meal. I would highly recommend this dive place for breakfast. YouTube has a video I just found after posting my review. m.youtube.com/watch?v=yZ…
Awesome breakfast and even better service!  Ill def come back everytime im flying in or out of MDW airport.

Babe and I have been to Sammy's Kitchen several times and the more we go, the more we love it. Sammy's has one of Chicago's best breakfasts. Go early they close at 1:00pm. And they only except cash. It is refreshing to find a restuarant that caters to the customers. And the food "WOW".  Such large portions. Ham cut from the bone, large omelettes, big pancakes, triple eggs. All I can say is be sure to go. And I bet you the owners will remember you the next time you come, and you will be back.  Two thumbs up.

Love , love , absolutely love this place , my family and I have been coming for years, actually since we move near the neighborhood . Everyone in there I believe is to be family, and they are so kind and courteous . The food is so Delish! I two sons think it's "so cool!" In how they are remembered , also that the guys know their order ! Lol! If you happen to find yourself in this area, come visit ! You won't be disappointed .

Sarah at Atlantic Aviation pointed us in the direction of Sammy's for breakfast. Walked in and we were seated promptly.  We ordered standard breakfast stuff, eggs, bacon and home fries. All food was really good and service was provided with a smile. Out the door for $14 plus a $6 tip, can't beat it.
One of the best restaurants I've ever been to! Very affordable and the food was delicious. The staff was very friendly and they value their customers. A great quick stop before your flight.

This place is great. Close to the airport and very good food. I go with the cornbeef hash because I usually come for breakfast. The ham and eggs are good too.  The wife gets the meatloaf sandwich and I always snag a bite because it's bombay! Soups are great and, the burgers? It's called home of the 757 burger for a reason. Try it out! The place is small so, depending on what time you get there, there might be a small wait. It's well worth it though.  Have I mentioned the pricing yet? With how good the food is, you'd expect to pay more. You'll walk out with a full belly and a smile. Why? Because the food was great and the check did not hurt your daily budget.  Service is great. I mean, the guy grabbed my son's plate and cut his pancakes so my wife and I could enjoy our meal. Can't top service like that!   Coffee is delicious and always topped off. Tip em well! They deserve it! 5 stars with no hesitation.

A classic diner with homemade soups, amazing breakfast and an overall amazing experience. It looks like a dive from outside but is far from it. My favorite breakfast/ lunch place when I travel into Midway. I almost considered not posting this review because I don't like giving up my favorite "fishing holes" lol
Simple but good. The BEST service.  Polite, cheerful, friendly, honest.  But not intrusive.  They actually say excuse me.

Decided to come here after a long day of traveling. Super low prices for really delicious food. Staff is very friendly and accommodating. It can take a minute to find some parking, and they are cash only (there's an ATM at the gas station a block away) but definitely worth it. We will definitely be back!
Best spot ever for breakfast realy good ppl here too frendly service is on point  soups are good
Couldn't ask for a better breakfast. Everything I've ordered has been delicious. Sometimes there is a wait for seating, but it's totally worth it. Would highly recommend a visit.

What a delightful surprise...travelled from Virginia and wanted to grab a quick breakfast. Here at Sammy's Kitchen, we found quality food, great service and reasonable prices!  After our weekend downtown and before leaving Chicago, we went back and hands down, the best navy beans ever!! We felt we were sitting at Jonathan's mother's kitchen table eating a great home-cooked meal! Brian, Deliea, Bella & Mother Mary!

My sister and I stopped here for breakfast today.  Sammy's is about a mile from our childhood home, but never knew about it before reading reviews.  Had to wait a couple of minutes for a table, menus and water arrived quickly.  She had a veggie omelette and I had the four deuces....Two each of eggs, pancakes, sausage and bacon.  Food was good and cost us around $13, including coffee.  Stop here!

Oh my oh my everything looks looks like you'll never finish it which you  probably won't because they give you so much food but it is absolutely delicious service is good and amazing amazing dive hole in the wall grease spot whatever but it's clean it's fresh and delicious and the coffee is what we would expect. If you're in Chicago and you have a second get here before they're gone they don't need to grow they don't need text band you need to squeeze in.. fair warning use the side  door
Small, old school, greasy spoon type place. Best breakfast in the neighborhood. Love the "hungry man" skillet. The ham is excellent. Cash only though and not open on Sunday's.

Was looking for a restaurant close to the airport so we could meet our daughter for breakfast before sending the mother-in-law back to New Hampshire. After a Yelp search, found Sammy's, figured we would give it a try, it had great reviews. All I can say is WOW! Looks like a hole in the wall, it's small, we had to wait a bit for our party of 7, but it was clean, quick and cheap. The food was excellent!! Big portions. Everything homemade. 2 of my daughters had the cream of chicken and rice soup, it was so good. Got done in plenty of time to make her flight. Will definitely come back for breakfast the next time we are up this way.
Best place in Chicago to get a good old fashioned belt busting breakfast. Will definitely be coming back
Never judge a restaurant by its cover!! Amazing breakfast!!!! Ham and Eggs were on point!!
The food is great , service is welcoming and they makes you feel like your at home. Best breakfast/brunch place ever.
awesome place.  great atmosphere and friendly.  love the hamsteak.  service was great

The staff were great!! Very friendly and on top of their business. After getting off the plane, this place is a nice little pick me up and very conveniently located half a mile from the rental car center. Definitely would recommend.
Great service, great food and one hell of a menu. Everything cooked just right, big portions and low prices. Has been a while since Ive eaten so good and so much.
This place rocks it's super close to my job very affordable and good quality food! Can't ask for more! Thanks sammys

Great little find. My husband ordered the corn beef hash and 3 eggs. Large serving size with potatoes and toast. Eggs were cooked perfectly and the corn beef hash was delicious! I orders the party melt. Nice crispy buttery bread. The patty melt was a previously frozen patty and lacking flavor and that juiciness you get from a freshly made patty. Next time I will order the corn beef hash!
OMG! I fell in love with Sammy's Kitchen right when I walked through the door. The food was amazing.  And the staff are super friendly. Please try the HAM! And the coffee was delish!
The food potions are a wow and the food was delicious. The service was on point with a friendly old school diner feel.
Great hearty plentiful breakfast at an incredible price. Friendly, fast, efficient, and delicious too. What more could you want?

I stumbled upon Sammy's Kitchen after landing at Chicago Midway one morning. I hadn't eaten breakfast and found this place on Yelp. It's super close to Midway airport. They have a tiny parking lot attached and it looks like a total dive from the outside. But the place was cozy and quaint inside - almost every table was taken. We were warmly greeted and took a seat. The gentleman working there was so kind and attentive.  The food is classic American style breakfast food - pancakes, eggs, toast, bacon, etc. I ordered the "Deuces" - two pancakes (or French toast), two eggs any style, two bacon strips, and two sausage links. ALL FOR $3.95. What?! Now, this isn't fancy food but just good, comfort food breakfast. And it was tasty! The service is fast and extremely friendly. So if you find yourself near Midway and want some good breakfast at a super cheap price, come to Sammy's Kitchen.
Very good breakfast, friendly, hospitable service, GENEROUS portions, super affordable. Dirty grimy looking dining area, Filthy run down bathroom.

Great diner food. Very cheap nice sized portions. Coffee is not good, but thats the standard at most diners, and I'm a coffee snob, so take my point about the coffee for what its worth. Otherwise, service is good, and food was great.

This is a perfect example of don't judge a book by it's cover. This place doesn't look great from the outside but from the moment when stepped in the staff was super friendly to me, my friend and our daughters. I had just flown into Midway and we wanted a quick bite to eat. They give you tons of food for next to nothing . I will def be back because I travel to Chicago all the time. Thanks for the great service!! Note: This is a cash only diner.

This is the best breakfast place in the city. Everything is made from scratch.  I had the bone in ham and eggs and the 757 hamburger on different occasions and both were delicious. Bring your appetite because the portions are huge and the prices are right. Great all around service. If you're by midway airport this is a great a place to dine.
went there for meatloaf and got a whole meatloaf.  The food was great and the staff was friendly.  great place to eat

This was my first meal in Chicago and man was it super delicious! The server Jonathan was super attentive and sweet. He constantly made sure we had our drinks filled. He made some good recommendations since it was our first time there. We got the in bone ham which he recommended. It was delicious! The portions were big and price was very reasonable! Anyone looking for a breakfast spot, look no more! This place is very delicious.

First time visiting Sammy's Kitchen and we all loved it. Looks like a dive when you first pull up and when you walk in....but the food and service was impeccable. The staff is some of the best I've ever encountered. They were attentive without being overwhelming. Loved the hash browns...reminded me of the fried potatoes I ate for breakfast growing up. Had a little wait for the breakfast but it was worth it.  Tips for first-timers: * The door is on the side of the building adjacent to the parking lot (there's about 4 or 6 spaces). * The line starts outside of the restaurant in the parking lot area. We got a table right away and had time to kill and didn't realize there was a BIG line of peeps out there (so sorry, Sammy's Kitchen peeps...thank you for never making us feel like we needed to move it...rookie mistake on our part).  * Bring cash. Credit cards aren't accepted.  * Tip the staff generously...they are awesome!
Ate here based on yelp reviews. It was a very hearty breakfast. The bone-in ham was delicious. The staff was very polite and friendly.

At first glance, it's difficult to spot. I've lived in the midway area majority of my life and never even knew it was there! Parking is horrible. Price point is great, especially with the portions. The coffee wasn't the greatest, pretty much just brown water. The place itself looks a bit dirty and I have to wonder if the cook even uses gloves or proper hand washing. The fans and vents need some serious dusting, something I couldn't help but obsess about since they put them on full force whenever it is hot outside. They also do not have air conditioning. This is a popular law enforcement hang out, and is known to get pretty crowded mid-morning. They should look into expanding since their client base is growing. Service has always been great, it is family owned and they are very friendly, especially the handsome, very muscular son.  The ham and eggs is the best on the menu, next would be the Denver omelette. Something tasted musty when I first tried the chicken noodle soup, and the noodles pretty much melted in my mouth because of how overcooked they were.  If you need a meal that will fill up up under $10, this is the spot for you. Better carry out than dine-in.
Wonderful family owned place for a hearty breakfast. The food was filling and very tasty. The owner chatted us up and was super kind.

No frills food and service, one of my favorite hidden gems to have breakfast at. It's cash only but it's so in expensive you feel like you are getting more than you deserve. It can get busy but the Service is always on point. All I've ever ordered is breakfast but I've heard their lunch menu is to die for. Sammys kitchen is definitely one of Chicago's best.

First of all it was kind hard to figure out how to get to the parking. You. One up on it so quick and when you pass the one way steer the next street still takes you the wrong way. Anyway we found our way there and it was well worth it. It tastes just like it looks. Very homey. I don't give out four stars ez but this place was great from entry door to exit door. You seat yourself and everybody was very welcoming. A big guy with lots of muscles took our order. I posted a pic of the menu bc I almost didn't believe the prices for the amount of food you get. We just flew in and I read some of the other reviews and they were all correct. I had the Denver inlet with hash browns. It came with a choice of toast, muffin, or pancakes. My husband at the pancakes and I had a bite. They were very good. The inlet was huge and they gave me more potatoes than I could eat in two sittings. The only reason I didn't give five stars is because the place could have used a little cleaning. Yes the table was clean and the. Hits were too. It we sat next to the window and I noticed that the wall needed wiping and the Windows could have really used a wash. I would come here again  and recommend this place especially if you are really hungry and on a budget. Also, they came by to check on us quite often. Also the pancakes are huge and very tasty. Don't miss out on those!

Loved this place!! Food was delicious and cheap and huge portions. Pancakes were fantastic! Staff is super friendly and attentive and probably a huge reason why we enjoyed the place so much. So glad we stopped here!!!

I feel weird giving this place a 3-star review since everyone else seems to love it. Maybe I just came in on an off day.  I came in after years of hearing how awesome this place was and how great it food tasted. My daughter and I were running errands, so we decided to stop in before they closed. We were there for lunch, and it was packed. The lot and dining area are small, which is fine. We found a seat near the back and waited until someone took our order. Our waiter was okay. Not terribly attentive or friendly, but also didn't ignore us. The restaurant was busy, and the two waiters were busying themselves going from table to table. I had a chicken sandwich and I think my daughter had chicken tenders. We also split an order of fries. She had no complaints about her food and ate nearly everything on her plate. My sandwich was enormous. It was an entire butterflied chicken breast and was twice the size of the bun. It was, however, rather bland. There was no seasoning on it at all, not even salt or pepper. I was able to season it with what was sitting at my table, but I felt strange doing it because really, who doesn't season a piece of chicken before throwing it on the cooktop?  I may go back for breakfast one day, since that's what seems to get all the rave reviews, but I've been unimpressed with their options outside of breakfast.

All I am going to say is...this place rocks! Back to the truly old school diner mentality. AND GREAT FOOD..check picture out.nothing fancy just good food n people...ham portion is ernormous. Corn beef hash was great. Guy next to me had a chicken hoagie that looked like my name was on it

Visited this spot because it had great reviews on Yelp and wanted to try a new breakfast.  The place is small, but it makes up for it with the great service. It's a home cooked breakfast type of spot. Nothing "wow" about it as far as the food (my omelette was overcooked and coffee was meh).  Go here if you're in the are and want a very reasonably priced breakfast with great customer service and aren't looking for anything fancy.  I tried it, so now it's scratched off of my bookmark list. On to the next.  (4 stars is for the excellent customer service)

Cute little mom and pop restaurant very close to midway airport. Stopped here after picking up our rental, about 9am, very crowded, waited about 10 mins for a table. Large menu, super affordable. Two huge meals for only $16, can't beat that. The waiter took the time to sit and go over what they are known for and even gave recommendations once we thought we knew what we wanted to order. Food came out quickly. The only downside was I saw them buttering toast with their bare hands. I
Best place in town for breakfast! It's a small, hole-in-the-wall place that's run by a wonderful family! Everyone around loves this place, especially flight crews!

Sammy may be the best breakfast I have ever had. The value as well cannot be beat. The ham was outrageous and I ordered Greek toast as well...yum yum yum. Service fantastic as well! Can't wait to come back!
Excellent breakfast.  Atmosphere is not the greatest but food is top notch!  Highly recommend.
Good food, friendly service and great prices! The ham and eggs is a big meal for $6.95. The owner's son waited on us and he was attentive and kind. Thanks!

I love this place! They are cheap but super delicious. It's about a 6 min walk from where I work but me and my coworker don't mind walking for the food. The staff here is also super nice. It is a small little place and I wished this was a bigger place to accommodate more dine in customers but I don't mind taking it to go :)

Went for breakfast on Saturday morning and it was very busy. Was greeted right away and was offered water or coffee while we waited which was very nice of them. It's a small place so we knew wait would be a while. I decided to go with a ham and cheese omelet. And I wish I would have shared with someone because the portion was huge I could not finish it. Plus it came with 2 slices of toast. The ham is soo good definitely a must try. But for sure next time I'm trying the French toast they looked delicious. All in all a great experience staff is super friendly and very welcoming

I've driven by this place many a time and I never noticed it. I read the review on here, and yes the place was great. Ordered the ham on the bone and eggs, came with hash browns and toast, it was right on, not greasy with the right flavor. Coffee was a bit weak, but overall the food was very good. Small place, so you might have to wait a bit, but they move ppl in and out pretty fast.

I had a long layover at Midway and thought with my family nearby it would be great to find somewhere for breakfast so we could visit. Got on Yelp and found this little gem. Once I saw the reviews of Sammys I knew this was the place. They did not disappoint! From the moment we walked in we were taken care of like we were at a fine dining establishment. I wish I would have gotten their names but the gentleman working made sure our coffee was filled all the time, cut up my niece's French toast before bringing it to the table, opened the little creamers for our coffee, and when my sister sneezed he yelled "bless you!" from across the room. I know that seems like a small thing saying bless you but after the good service we had we knew this was a special place.  Now the food! The ham!!! You have to have the ham. Normally when you ask for a slice of ham for breakfast you get the typical quarter inch slice of ham. At Sammys you get an inch thick, maybe more, piece of ham. It was so tender and seasoned to perfection. My mom and I shared an omelette because I read portions are generous here. Glad we did because it was more than enough for two people. It was the best omelette I have had in a long time. The ingredients tasted fresh and it was perfectly cooked. For all four of us to eat it was only $16! You can't beat that.  My sister and I agreed even if I don't have a layover again in Chicago, the next time I'm visiting my family we are going to make the trip to Sammys just for the experience and food again.

Definitely will come back here . I walked in for the first time to this restaurant and asked where the nearest ATM is because I noticed the note on the door said cash only and I did not have cash. Surprisingly, they sat me and my girl down right away and told us to just pay them back next time we came around. I was very happy with this!  When the food got to our table we noticed that the food comes in large portions and has a very generous price. I literally spent just $15 bucks on 2 people (excluding tip) and with the amount of food they gave us I had to be rolled out in a wheel chair! Also, the food tastes great, and the food along with the outstanding service makes for a great deal! All In all, the great tasting food, great service, and the very nice staff made me have a outstanding experience!    P.S I don't know how often the manager/owner of the restaurant reads these things but I just want to  say thanks for your generosity . We will definitely be back soon!

If you are near by Midway Airport and you got some time early in the morning for a good breakfast you've got to stop here for the price and for great food Great place to go eat breakfast ham and eggs hash browns pancakes including lunch

This is a good spot to hit if youre in the area!!!! Portions are HUGE and food is good.Place is filled with cops,firefighters and city workers along with pretty much everybody else from the neighborhood.You'll never know its there unless you know its there.About the only downside is its hard to find a spot to sit at sometimes because its ALWAYS PACKED.Prices are ridiculously low!!! You can have a nice breakfast for the price of a Starbucks Venti Latte and that might even include coffee!!!!! Ok,maybe add $1 BUT STILL!!!!! Its very hard to beat the prices!!!!! You wont leave hungry thats for sure.

Had to drive someone to midway early one morning. Don't be put off by the outside structure. Place was clean. Food was great and cheap. Felt welcome and had more than I could eat. Bring cash; they don't take credit or debit. Food is homemade. Quite popular local spot. Will definitely go back when in area. They even gave me a coffee to go as I had an hour ride home.

What a great little find! This place from the outside makes you think twice about entering, but we are sure glad we did! Great food! Fantastic prices! Small feel in a big city! Great staff caring employees. I am glad that we found this on yelp and decided to go in even though at first we questioned it. Sometimes you have to step outside your comfort zone and try something new and we are glad we did.

WOW! this place was amazing! definitely a hole in the wall. after a long night of drinking, me and a friend of mine wanted to get breakfast,  neither of us were chicago natives, so we looked to yelp for help. and i'm so glad we did! we arrived around 10am and the wait was about 25 minutes! **THEY close at 12 on saturday so get in before 11. :) I ordered pancakes and hashbrowns and my friend got the hungry man platter! neither of these dishes will disappoint! Everything was delicious and affordable. both of our orders ended up being 12 dollars.  **note it is CASH ONLY. if i ever make my way to chicago again, and i'm out in this area,  i will definitely come here!

This place is awesome!   It was hard to figure out how to get in...use the side back door by the parking lot. Once inside this place has loads of character and is filled with locals.  The staff is beyond friendly and helpful....so nice and accommodating!!!   The food yummy...some of the best French toast ever.  The ham is HUGE and scrumptious.  Love this place!  Came here because of Yelp reviews otherwise would have never known about it.  Would love to come back when in the area again.   Morning and afternoon hours only.  Yum!  Bravo!
How can you beat a combination of very good food, generous portions, blue-collar prices and  attentive service?  On a scale of 1 to 10, Sammy's is an 11.

Small place with good home cooking. Service was nice and fast and all the food tasted great. My friend had the Denver omelette and really liked it and the chicken sandwich had generous portions and cooked perfectly.

Firstly... The Ham off the bone is fantastic but the star of this dish may just be the freshly sliced potatoes. I tried to visualize them all stacked up and it looks to be about a whole potato.... You can't even classify these as hash browns because they are fresh sliced fried potatoes just like mom would make back in the day!  Coming from a true meat n' potatoes guy this meal for $8 and change is truly amazing!!!!! My mother would be proud of this place and I'd be proud to take her here. When they say great home cooked meal at a real down home price they mean it! This is Chicago at its very best.  Everyone was greeted on a first name basis as they entered. Seriously if you had to count on one hand the places that still happens you'd be flipping me off. I had a nice long conversation about the weather with a stranger probably in his 70's at the counter while others joined in from there typical "spots" This is probably my favorite new (to me) Chicago restaurant. I can't believe I've slept on this joint so long. I'll be here every time I come to Midway, if it were closer this is the place I'd have breakfast every single day for the rest of my life.

Say whattttttttt!?!?!? Lol. Feels like home. I swear everyone that works there is a part of the family. Very laid back, casual, no frills which is why you can get 4 pieces of bacon, hash browns, 3 eggs, toast, and a soda for $6.45! Craziness u tell ya....but in a good way. I would have liked for the hash browns to have a little more flavor. But salt and pepper did the trick. Awesome customer service and quick food service as well. You can tell it's a place where the locals go. When I'm passing through again for my next work trip I'll stop back by.

GREAT PLACE TO EAT!!!!! I have to say that at first I was a bit hesitant because it looks like a bar and not a family restaurant. But I was wrong !!! Sure it's nothing fancy BUT the food and service is great!!!! And at a great price 4 adults and a child for under 40 bucks . The best ham and eggs I ever tasted... I live so close to this place I just regret not trying it sooner.... Sorry no pics ... I forgot !!! Or I was just too hungry...
Cheap Prices, Large portions and good basic food.  Place is nothing fancy but the food is good.  Cash Only.  Soda pop by the cans.  Small dining room.
Just flew in from NY and had breakfast here... the food was AMAZING!!! Pancakes where the best I've had - blows away IHOP!
Food was beyond good! I had the corned beef hash and it was great. They serve a lot for a cheap price! I will definitely be going back soon!!

We know nothing about Chicago so when we landed at Midway airport we searched for somewhere nearby to get some breakfast.  This place was close and had good reviews so we headed there.  This is just a small joint, nothing fancy...but the food was sooo good. The service was amazing...they acted like we were old friends and my coffee cup was kept full and hot.  And as others came in and out we could tell that the have a lot of regulars frequenting the place.  The prices are very low for the amount of food you get.  I was starving and could not finish my plate.   They only take cash.  We may be going back before our flight out of Chicago as well.
Lived in this neighborhood as a kid and this was a taste of home. Small family place with great food and lots of it!  Super nice people - absolutely worth the trip.
The breakfast was exactly what we were looking for. The pancakes were heavenly and the omelette was cheesy yumminess! The staff and local patrons were all extremely friendly! Loved it!

This is a very warm & friendly environment. I am pleased to see that this family style restaurant still manages to exist, and on the southside too! The food was good, the atmosphere was pleasant, the prices were extremely modest, and the staff attended to our every needs. Absolutely awesome!
Great service! Great food! Come hungry. Leave satisfied. Just off our early morning flight to Midway airport. 2 minutes away is this wonderful restaurant.

This is not a tipical kind of breakfast place. Very small but it has that home like feel to it. I think it's family own which is great. Only cash so thank God I had some cash. Prices are really good for the quality, flavor and taste. Awesome service! loved how they take care of us.  The menu is small but pretty much everything we had was so freshly delicious. We had a ham and cheese omelet with hash potatoes and pancakes, french toast with bacon, eggs and sausage. The bacon was so crispy and tasty. We loved the food. Coffee could be a little tiny bit stronger but I don't blame them. I love strong coffee. We definitely left surprisingly very happy! Definitely recommended and will be back soon.

What a great find for a quick breakfast before a road trip home. The diner only seats 36 people but the pleasant home style environment made it worth the short wait. They take care of there customers with a smile.  I had the 747 burger and it did not disappoint, it held me down for the duration of my day of sight seeing in Chicago. I my family loved there breakfast and was absorbed by the hospitality.
Nice breakfast. Decent prices. Very polite waiter and close to Midway. What was not to like? Wish the hashbrowns came without eggs.
If you are near Chicago Midway and want a quick bite of quality food at a cheap price, come here! The staff is awesome, the locals seem frequent and the food is just outstanding!

Jason, age 13, says "the French toast is well cooked and really delicious. Hash browns are truly fantastic. The bacon is really good. All around, this is one of the best restaurants I have ever seen." I would add, this dive is grimy, gritty and fun. I feel like I am in Chicago on steroids. Prices are great, service is typical for this part of town. It is a cultural experience. Love it!

If you always want to boycott airport food, now you have the right to do so.   Sammy's Kitchen is on the "northwest" corner of the Midway Airport (if thinking about the airport as a giant square).  Nothing was attractive about this little breakfast joint.  However, as long as you were courageous enough to walk in, you would walk out satisfied and feeling "fly."   I had their famous 1lb. ham off-the-bone with hash browns, over-easy eggs, and English muffins.  As soon as the entire plate was brought to our table, I was "shocked" by the size of the ham; it was large, meaty, and delicious!  The ham wasn't salty at all.  While I was attempting to conquer my "piggy friend," I had to sneak in a piece to Daddy J. because this $6.50 breakfast platter was super filling!   Daddy J., on the other hand, had his daily fix of bacons, sausages, and eggs.  His combo also came with the toast.  He's a fan of western-style breakfasts, and Sammy's certainly hit the jackpot for him this morning.   Ready for our total: two (2) blue-collar entrees and coffee with unlimited refills: $15.46!!  We were so lucky that we spotted the available seating upon walking in.  There was a line at 1100 hour on a random Tuesday afternoon.  Many patrons were police officers (yes, follow them because they are doing their community-orient patrolling through restaurant visiting), city of Chicago workers, locals, and travelers.   Now the secret of avoiding airport food is officially out...

What nice people!!  I ordered a patty melt and they asked which of their soups did I want:  Split pea or chicken noodle.  I said split pea as I love split pea soup.  So, he says, "well I'll give you a bowl, then."  It was delicious - but a huge bowl, so I took my sandwich home.  On the way out, I tell him how good the soup was and he tells me that they make it fresh every Tuesday with a good meaty ham bone.  I said it was really good - so, he comes back with, "Do you want to take some home?  I'll give you a couple of cups as we just throw it out at the end of the day, anyway."  Well, he gave me two huge cups (my wife is eating part of one right now) at no charge. I'll be back!!  It is worth going into a restaurant that has such nice people.
We go here all the time. Quick food service, where they know you is the best. This place is an example of great service.
Mom and pop breakfast at its finest. Ham off the bone was delicious. Good portions good food cheap prices what more can you say. Very small quarters but staff is friendly and courteous. Great service

It doesn't look like much when you pull up - I was fearful of it being a dive, but how wrong I was.  We were greeted by excellent staff who you could tell really cared for their reputation and were very modest and friendly to strangers.  Best hash browns that I've ever eaten (sorry grandma).  Two breakfasts were brought to us quickly, and it was a ton of food.  The final bill was $10.65... TOTAL.  Find this place and try it out!
Great find!!! Excellent service, good breakfast food at crazy good prices! We will be back!

After a morning of traveling, we were in desperate need of breakfast. After picking up our rental car from Midway, we just drove 2 seconds and saw Sammy's Kitchen. Best decision we made was stopping here. Everything was served to perfection and for the price you pay it almost feels like you're paying double for what you're getting. I will always come back to this restaurant whenever I am in the city!
Food was excellent! Great service, would have given 5 stars if the air conditioner was on.
The best home cooked meal you will ever eat.  Just like grandmas or moms kitchen. I love this place. Get the meat loaf you will never be disappointed. NEVER..

After an early morning flight and no where to be any time soon, this place was perfect for recharging the batteries. Outstanding food and service coupled with prices that you will find no where else in Chicago, makes this the ideal breakfast spot for the tired traveler. I would highly recommend.

I hated flying out of Midway...but not anymore!  Someone told me about this little gem of a restie and it makes the dreaded Midway experience A-OK.  Everything here and I mean everything is homemade.  The meatloaf and soups remind me of my Grandma's cooking.  It is seriously good. Don't get me started on their breakfasts.  Oh Gawd!  The ham is off the bone and then grilled.  The potatoes and trust me you will get a pile of them are perfect when I add a touch of salt and splash of ketchup.   Prices are obscenely cheap.  I don't know how they do it.  The place is tiny and you'll run into quite a few characters but everyone is friendly and I dig the vibe.

Been coming here often in the last couple of months and I haven't been disappointed. Service is always great even though at times you might have to wait but trust me it's worth it. Big portions and reasonably priced. The French toast is highly recommended (my favorite), will be back to try other items on the menu it's all looks excellent.

Oh. My. God. This place is amazing! I was skeptical at first, since they're famous for their ham and eggs. I was like, "How can ham and eggs be good or bad? it's just ham and eggs, they're all the same." Boy was I wrong. The ham was so thick and juicy and ... well, D-E-L-ICIOUS!! I'm also impressed about the service. They're all family and they're all bet attentive and genuinely nice people!

This place is really good. Everything that I've tried has been mostly breakfast although I tried the corn beef sandwich on marble rye and that was pretty good. This place is small and is only a brunch place. There is usually a line but you get seated fairly quickly. It's also only cash.
Low prices, massive portions, friendly staff A little dilapidated. Could use a deep clean and new sign out front!

This is an 8 table family owned gem who's mom is the cook. Her soups are divine. Nobody ever made bean soup like my mom, except this mom. Everything on the menu is fresh and home made. Bring your appetite because the portions are huge. Awesome corned beef and I saw a lot of meat loaf orders being taken. There's one thing they also have. Amazing service by the boys. Prices are unbelievably low for what u get. A gem!

Found this place on yelp. I had been on an early flight into Chicago and was looking for some breakfast. After picking up my rental car I asked Yelp for breakfast in the vicinity Sammy's was rated number one. I can see why! At first I was not going to go in because it looks more like a bar than a breakfast joint but changed my mind after reading reviews and seeing that it was in the best of Chicago.I went in. Very friendly staff great food with overly abundant portion.  The off the bone him was ridiculous, HUGE portion but delicious. The only reason I gave it 4 stars was because it really is a little hole in the wall but the food was great as was the service and friendliness of the other guests
Amazing breakfast! It's a great local diner with large helpings for very little money. The servers look like firemen, which is nice eye candy! Anytime I fly from Midway I'm eating at Sammys

Finally made a second visit today, since I had to drop a buddy off at Midway. He offered to pay for breakfast, so this place came to mind. It had been 5 months since my first visit and the 1 lb. ham steak, so I had it again.  The service is friendly and it can get busy. Jonathan and Barbara are great hosts. Glad to see their Chicago's Best TV episode on YouTube has over 21k views. The food is so fresh and hot, I need to find more reasons to make more visits. Their Split Pea on Tuesdays is a must. Meatloaf looks mighty tasty too.

Don't let the outside fool you, this place is great. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. The menu is shorter than a chain diner might be, but they have specials that make up for it. The food is delicious and comes is large portions at good prices. You leave full. I'd recommend Sammys to anyone.

Super Hearty meals, as delicious as breakfast can be! Ham n eggs comes with a slab of ham which is nice & tender, not dry or rough, and homemade hashbrowns which were phenomenal. I had the Hungryman which was also gr8. Wife had the Four Deuces 3s. All meals come with choice of toast or pancakes & priced under $7! Super filling and big portions. Bring ur appetite!!

i had an occasion to visit midway, and i just "happened" to end up in sammy's kitchen for breakfast. both lady and a guy who greeted me and took my order were super nice, and very attentive. as soon as i glanced through the menu, i was amazed at crazy cheap price, 6.25 or something for ham, potatoes, and eggs! to be honest, the place itself is definitely not your date course, nor your fine dining experience. the building itself looks almost run-down, chair and tables are way out of sync.  what really was shining about this place was just like how many other yelpers have said, very attentive and friendly service, and crazy cheap price. food itself was decent too. large portion of food, and taste like typical good american diner you would expect. overall, if i lived relatively close distance from sammy's i could see myself devouring those salty hams every week, but alas, i live way too far from here so that's a shame. highly recommended!!
Good food, great service, friendly staff and very reasonable prices. What more could you ask for. I know open on Sundays because I work most Saturdays Keep it up, Ill be back my next weekend off.

I do not like them, Sam-I-am. I do not like green eggs and ham. Yeah? Well Sam-I-Am ain't nevah had ham like this, or he would change his tune!!!! THE SCENE One of the many reasons I love breakfast so much is because of being raised in Chicago. I always thought it was just our family, but it seems eating breakfast ANYTIME of day is a long standing tradition throughout the city.  On a recent trip back home I discovered most of the places I grew up loving are no longer in business. Glady's Kitchenette was the benchmark of the best breakfast anywhere and it has sadly bit the dust along with other favorites like Miss Muffets on 79th and Bobby's on 90th. These were iconic spots that vividly materialize in my minds-eye everytime I think of the best breakfast places I've ever eaten. Bobby's and Miss Muffets in particular served their breakfast with ham carved off the bone! Let me tell you a secret... You haven't eaten breakfast until you've eaten breakfast with a giant slab of fresh cut ham! So when I heard Sammy's Kitchen was serving breakfast with fresh off the bone ham, I made it my duty to pay them a visit. Besides, they were only minutes from our hotel.   THE EXPERIENCE Located in a tiny building with an even tinier parking lot on the corner of 55th and Luna Lane you will find this quaint little hole in the wall establishment. Nothing about this place is standard. The entrance door was propped open and you could see directly into the kitchen. I assumed it was a side door and walked around to the font of the building trying to find a proper entrance! NOT!!!  The moment you walk in , to your right is a dark storage area with public restrooms just behind it. Directly in front of you is the kitchen counters and to the left is the dining room with a mish-mash of tables and chairs. It's a busy place, so without much standing room you tend to find people standing wherever they can, but generally blocking the entrance. This created a bit of a traffic jam for those coming in, those going out and the staff who unfortunately have to keep the refrigerated drinks and silverware outside of the kitchen near the congestion. You will hear  "excuse me, I just need to get in there" often as you wait to be seated. It took us 20 minutes to be seated, but honestly it flew by as I spent most of that time in conversation with my Chicago brethren waiting with me to be seated. THE FOOD Sammy is the definition of the term "service with a smile." They truly go out of their way to make you feel welcome and at home. They initially got my order wrong, but never sent it out because the manager/owner caught the mistake. They promptly told me of the error, but assured me they were working hard to get the order out quickly, and they did!  - HAM & EGGS (3.75 stars) | $6.50 It wasn't the exact flavor explosion I was looking to experience, but it did the trick. I enjoyed the ham more than the eggs.   - FRENCH TOAST (3.5 stars) | $3.95 - VEGETARIAN OMELETTE SPECIAL (4 stars) | $4.50 My wife loved it! Included onions, pepper, mushrooms, cheese, hashbrowns and toast. - CORNED BEEF HASH (1 star) | $  I did not enjoy this at all. Cooked too hard and had very little flavor. - Pancakes (3.75 stars) | included as a substitution - Hash browns (3 stars) | included  This is old school Chicago style hash browns. Good, but would be awesome if they were seasoned.  Featured on the TV show "Off the Bone":  youtube.com/watch?v=yZ6J… FINAL THOUGHTS The portions are enormous, especially the ham slice, which could have fed my family all winter! I believe it is right at one pound of grilled porky deliciousness. We all enjoyed our meal and none of us could finish our plates because of the sheer amount of food. If I had any complaints it would be they added waaaaay to many onions to my eggs and I wish the hash browns were seasoned. Other than that we found the meal to be very enjoyable and super easy on the wallet.  Service: 5 stars Reasonable Prices: 5 stars Food: 3.5 stars I DO like them Sam-I-Am, I really do like their glorious ham!
This place, literally shack in a corner. The staff is awesome the food is amazing! Sammy's kitchen will definitely be the go to place:)

If you haven't been to Sammy's you're absolutely missing out. I had a hard time deciding between an omelet and the day's special, Yankee pot roast. (Yes it was only 8am, but pot roast is always delicious) I ended up with both entrees and they were both excellent. This place isn't fancy, but customer service was out of this world. I can't remember ever being treated so well. I will go back any time I find myself flying into Midway, or heck in Chicago at all. These folks have earned a lifetime customer. As a side note, parking can be a challenge but give it a few min and it will work out.

After hearing so many good things about Sammy's ,  I was realllly looking forward to going there.   Lemme tell ya,  when we first walked in,  I mouthed the word DUMP to my hubby, and lo and behold, how right we were.  This place was jumpin when we get there, and we had to wait a few mins for a table. ( to our surprise!!) When we sat down at our table by the window, I was disgusted by the filth of the window we were sitting next to and the numerous flies that were enjoying our breakfast more than we were.  Thank goodness the food was cheap--I could make an omelet better blindfolded than the ones we had.   They got one thing going for them-- the friendly staff , who were exceptionally nice considering it was a thousand degrees in there. If you enjoy dining with bugs and dirt, this is your place!

I hate Sundays because this place is closed on Sunday.  Such a great place to take your family for a meal. The food/service is always exceptionally great. Servers will always try to meet your needs. I've never been to a place where I instantly get a smile just from walking into a place. Food what can I say your stomach will thank you for eating here. Pick anything from the menu and I can guarantee that you'll love it.  Once you eat here you'll want to come back.
Better than expected food, cheaper than expected price and the best service I have ever had.

I can't say enough great things about his little place.  I've only been here a handful of times and every time my experience is better.  See I live in Boston and my best friend lives in Chicago.  I can only visit here 2-3 times a year but every time she comes to pick me up from Midway we stop here to eat.  It's basically on the corner of the airports property in a little neighborhood surrounded by residential homes.  It's easy to find and easy to park.  It looks like you're going into someone's home, and that's pretty much how the staff makes you feel.  There's usually police officers or airport personnel eating here which is a good sign that it has good food, since they know all of the surrounding options. The food is great and they have huge portions.  Nothing super special about the menu, just a basic breakfast and lunch diner-ish feel.  The soup is probably the only "stand out" item on the menu.  They have a couple of soups made fresh every day which is nice.   The best part of this place however is the staff, I'm not sure if it's family owned and operated but it definitely has that feel.  I've been here about 5 times over the course of 2 years and I swear they remember me and it's usually the same 2-3 people working there.   The last time I went was 07/14/2014.  I was there early in the morning and my friend and I ordered breakfast.  We sat at the bar area and I was telling the waiter how I had just come off of working 8 hours and drove straight to the airport for my flight and that I was exhausted.  When we got up to pay for our breakfast he handed us 2 brown paper bags with soup to go for each of us so we could have some after we got up from our naps.  Seriously?  That is amazing.  It's things like that that make me wish I lived closer so I could come here more often.  I highly recommend!

I've gone back probably too many times to count at this point! Every single thing I've ever ordered I have loved! Staff is ALWAYS great . I think my favorite two menu items to order are the chicken breast special with mashed potatoes and green beans and a bacon cheeseburger (aside from the amazing soups that come with an order). I know it's normally crowded in here but we never mind waiting!

Loved this place! Delicious food! Both my friend and I had the Four Deuces breakfast and it was cooked just like we asked for. Generous sized serving at a very reasonable price! Super friendly staff.  Cash only.  The restaurant is pretty small, so be prepared to wait if it's busy...but absolutely worth the wait!

Did lunch today! I had the Corned Beef sandwich and my boyfriend took down the 757 burger. No complaints here. They were generous with the corned beef and it tasty. 757 burger was great it was topped with the best onion rings I have ever had. And as always, service was great!

This place is the BEST. After taking my daughter to breakfast this morning I went to pay and realized they don't take debit/credit and the gentleman says next time you drive by you can pay !!! Not many businesses are accommodating like that any more, I ran to the bank and returned about 10 minutes later to pay with a good a tip of course. The food and service was a 10 out of 10 and we will be returning. TOTALLY AWESOME

Love this place Nothing fancy and I love it, It's all about the food. simple, big portion inexpensive food. Service is great, super relaxed and cool.   Just recently discovered this place and I have been here many times. Even have a usual already, Veggie omelet and pancakes.  SK, great place

This has to be one of the best places for real home cooking in the Chicago area for breakfast or lunch.  I don't think you can find a better value for the money.  The food is outstanding and the prices are unbeatable. Not to mention the staff provides great service and are very welcoming. The only downside is it is a bit small and gets crowded very fast.  It is by no means fancy inside but the food value and friendly staff make up for it.  Give it a try you won't be disappointed.

I've read reviews on this place before so decided to try it out last weekend for breakfast. Got there about 10am and it was completely packed (granted there are only about 10 tables in the restaurant). We ordered our food and decided to place it to go as we didn't want to wait for a table to open up. About 5 min after we ordered a table opened up and the man at the register (I believe he is the owner) offered us to sit there if we wanted to eat in. We assured him we were fine taking it to go so he offered it to the next people in line ( a line forms out the door with people waiting to get a table). While we stood by the counter waiting for our food I got a good chance to observe the employees and I must say they are very busy and do a great job! After about 20 minutes our food was ready and we walked up to pay and the man would not take our money. He told us it was on the house for being so patient and waiting. I could not believe it!! It's great to know that there are still people in this world who care about their customers and believe in good customer service. The food was also very good....I got the vegetarian omelette and my boyfriend got the pepper and egg sandwich. The pepper and egg sandwich is the best I have had in the area! I will definitely be back not only because of the food but mostly because of the exceptional customer service! We plan to go back for breakfast this weekend and leave a generous tip!! Great job Sammy's!!! My only negative would be that I cannot find a menu online.

Really nice guy taking orders and was very attentive to serving us.  Excellent spot to get a quick bite near Midway.  Only issue was the cleanliness of the joint and kept me from giving it an A-OK.  I have no problem with divey joints but when there's flies in the place and part of eggs come out with stains of gray from a dirty grill...I'm gonna think twice about eating there in the future.  Still more positives on value and service so I will give them another shot in the future and update accordingly.
Food's quite good and there's a lot of it! Very filling breakfast for two was ~$11 with a drink. Highly recommended

Breakfast I was happy to pay for.  If you have a layover at Midway you can walk here. Sammy's is high speed, low drag, no white table cloths, plastic dishes, and you can't beat the price for the taste.  It's not open late, they have some small tables to seat four, some half booths, and three windows.  Came in for some breakfast (of course) and was greeted with some very courteous and respectful service.  The menu has just enough items to give you options without getting you to stall.  A meal with a large orange juice averages $6 per person.  What a steal!  Feel free to pay for your meal at the counter. Pancakes: Fluffy, good size. Veggie Omelet: Not greasy.  I might say a bit dry but that's a personal preference.  Low on salt and highly customizable. Orange Juice: no pulp, tastes fresh. Parking: East and west side of the building.  West side of the building is a bar but I'm quite sure they don't open until after Sammy's closes.  North side of building is reserved, don't park there. Finally! A great breakfast spot that doesn't take 30+ minutes to drive to and keeps the budget happy.

Best value in all of Midway for a quick eat. My son is in love with the pancakes here.  The best part of Sammies has to be the service. I can honestly say that there are many fine dining restaurants that could take a lesson in customer service from these guys. Everyone is so attentive and friendly.  I would recommend it to anybody who is in the area. Don't be fooled by the outside facade, it looks like its part of the bar next door.

I loved my breakfast.  Hot, fast, delicious and reasonably priced.  Looking forward to going back for lunch.  I wish I would have visited sooner.  It is nothing fancy inside and it gets crowded, but worth it.

Stopped in before my flight out to grab a quick breakfast. Glad I did!!!! I was greeted promptly, got some water and juice served up and ordered a Veggie omelet in about 45 seconds total. FAST FAST FAST!!! Omelet was cooked PERFECT!!!  I didn't care for this style of hash brown, too much hash.. not enough brown. Maybe I should have ordered them crispy? So it was like $7 for a tall OJ, killer omelet, and a buttered English muffin.  And like one reviewer said, it's got a lot of cops in it!!!  I laughed when I read that one, it's true. Good news is you won't worry about your car being messed with while you're inside stuffing your face with awesomeness!!!!

This is a no frills big portion comfort meal kind of place. I heard that the City of Chicago might have bought the land that they sit on, so their days may be limited. So get it before it is gone. Eggs and hammy at Sammy's!

Ahh Sammy's.  If you want the same quality (or better) food than Huck Finn but cheaper then come here.  Tiny little restaurant next to the airport but very cozy.  I think if they tossed in about $5-10K into this place it could look nicer but then maybe the prices wouldn't be as cheap.  Overall good food and good service.

We needed a good breakfast on the way home from our Chicago Midway hotel, and Sammy's came up on Yelp.  It may look not so good on the outside, but it was warm and welcoming on the inside.  The staff is excellent, and really cares about your food.  There are lots of regulars, but the owner told me that since they got reviewed on Yelp, they are getting people from all over the country.  He was pretty proud of this. Downside...no oatmeal.  Upside, fast service, fresh food, bone in ham, excellent prices (we both ate for less that $15.00).  This is a neighborhood place, so be ready for it to be full.  Use the side door only, off the parking lot.   We wouldn't go back for breakfast, but only because they didn't have oatmeal.  They have an awesome list of entrees and specials, however, for other meals.  Maybe then?

We were looking for local breakfast place before leaving Chicago.  Found the perfect place. Everything was awesome. The owner recommended the ham and eggs and French toast. Right in the money. Out of this world! Great tasting and so much food, they made me a sandwich with my leftover ham. 2 people for under $15. Crazy! Flying out of Midway airport? Take some extra time and eat at Sammy's. Your won't be disappointed.
The owner & family are great people, I have always felt welcomed there.Food is great & prices are unbelievable .... I Love this place,chicken soup is just like Grandma's.
Great food. even better prices! Personal service. Place is always busy- which says alot.

Loved it! Agree that it may not look so great but the food and service were wonderful. Small family owned, only open till 1:00 pm. Breakfast was 2 large pancakes, 2 bacon, 2 sausage and 2 eggs for $3.95! Coffee was delicious and only $1.25. Seemed like lots of locals enjoy the spot. They do have lunch specials... Reuben sandwiches and stuffed cabbage the day we were there.  Nice to eat from outside the golden arches!
Absolutely fantastic food and service! Not many joints on the south side are run like this anymore. Good quality cheap eats! Gonna hate to see it go...
Great vegetarian omelet, great service. Love the neighborhood atmosphere. Not fancy, but has a really good vibe. Would definitely return next time I fly into Midway. Thanks, Yelpers!
good food, great service. yes decor is fine, this is why they can charge $6 for a perfect omlete.
Looks like a dump from the outside, but the food was good and very inexpensive. It's got some good ol' south side character :)  Good breakfast option if you're stuck around Midway.
The best little eatery near Midway....Everything is great and the folks who run it really aim to make everyone feel at home...very good food and very reasonable prices!!!!!

After an exhausting few days of packing, we came to Sammy's after our movers put everything into our Upack containers.  We were starved and weren't disappointed at the homecooked food.  The price was right at about $8 for my chicken sandwich, fries, and a cup of delicious chicken noodle soup.  Seemed like it was a friendly, local joint where everyone knew each other.  It's probably a place for all the cops to eat at as there were nearly 7 or 8 while we were there.  Service was excellent and we were asked 2 times if we needed anything else.  It's definitely a dive from the 80's that could use in some sprucing up decor-wise, but it's not a big deal.  It's just delicious diner food at great prices!
Agree with everything said.  Great food, great prices, excelent service and it's a diner.

Good, cheap food and great service.   Yes, the decor is a bit like you've entered a time warp but who cares? It's the best place for breakfast in the neighborhood.  Not much else to say - it is worth a visit.

OMG, everyone needs to go to this place. It's a small, verrrry small, family-run restaurant hooked onto a bar. You will not find more reasonable food in the city, plus it is DELICIOUS! Don't get distracted by the aging decor, think shabby chic... Head here for Saturday breakfast / early lunch (they close at 11:30am and are not open on Sundays) or stop by for either meal during the week (open until 1pm). Servers are friendly and treat you like family. All the food is terrific, but don't leave without getting a cup / bowl of the cream of chicken with rice soup. It's a bit salty, but you won't find tastier soup anywhere in the city. Like I said above, this place is tiny! The earlier you get there (before 8 or 9am), the better your chances of scoring a table. Sometimes you may have to wait 15-20 minutes. Parking can be tight during busy times, and you may need to circle the residential block to find a spot if you aren't lucky enough to score something in the 2 tiny lots. Food is usually served very quickly. Tons of cops eat here, so it must be good, right? RIGHT!
